40427820.review:
Крайне разочаровывающий проект, особенно как файтинг, особенно после  "Fighting is Magic", разработанный на энтузиазме и это, не принимаю во внимания того факта, что персонажей как и вселенную разработала великая женщина Лоурен Фауст или того, что проект делался ни один год, с бюджетом почти 500 тыс. долларов.

1) Отсутствие нормальной "защиты" персонажа. Вместо того, чтобы вынести блокировку от вражеских ударов на ОТДЕЛЬНУЮ кнопку, чтобы было еще как минимум в старой Mortal Kombat Ultimate (на минуту вышедшей еще в 95 для Сеги, у которой, в отличие от контроллера геймпада всего было  6 кнопок в наличие), разработчики так и оставили идею блокироваться "стиком", который отвечает за движение персонажа и выполнения комбо-аспектов.  Ещё сюда же стоит привести тот факт, что персонажи вообще не умеют бегать, только небольшой спринт, следовательно сократить дистанцию с каким-нибудь кастером (той же Олиндер) почти становится нереально.

2) "Синдром тряпичной куклы", который вытекает из первого пункта, а именно некоторые индивиды заучитывают базовое комбо в сочетание с воздушным, после чего вас просто швыряют из угла в угол, или же избивают в этом же углу. Просто потому что анимация вашего падения заканчивается позже, чем атаки противника, соотвественно противнику ничего не мешает повторять эту комбу раз за разом, пока ваш персонаж будет долетать до земли. 

3) Наличие бесполезных вещей \ задумок.  Зачем нужно было вводить раздел Таргет (побить по тарелочкам) - Аркад мод - Лобби - Тренировочный раздел, когда все это есть в Пиксель-лобби. Гораздо лучше, было бы сделать 1-2 миссии в стори-моде (с анимационными или комиксовыми кат-сценками), которые оставляли бы у людей чувство острого голода, постегнутого хорошей закуской. 

4) Подземелие ... В Пиксель-лобби у вас есть возможность отправиться на вторую локу этой карты, где вы будет сражаться с теми самыми Хищниками (с основными антагонистами сюжетки игры). Зачем? Видите ли основная причина туда идущих людей  - это выбивание шмоток для вашей пиксельной модельки персонажа, которые вы достаете из рандомных сундуков падающих из воздуха. При все этом, даже здесь можно увидеть абсолютную халтуру:

-  Начнем хотя с того, что выйти из Подземелий нельзя, только позволив умереть вашему персу в сражение с Хищником.
-  Искусственный интеллект Хищников просто поражает своей уникальностью, как и весь ИИ в этой игре ( блокирование 90%  ударов, дикое АУЕ, в особенности у Анаконды  - ммм баланс ) 
-  Отсутствие простой карты навигации. Да я понимаю, карта не особо большая, можно запомнить, но почему и нет? Серьезно. Также видимо авторы вдохновлялись идей корейского рандома, т.к. сундуки могут и не падать вообще, то есть правильно - вы нарезаете 6-7 кругов по одним тем же участкам карты, но сундуков как не было, так и не будет. А ещё отвратительная дизайнерская идея делать переходы между участками чёрными квадратами - прям так и вижу вдохновение инди-проектами за 5 долларов ...
-  Вход в подземелие платный. Более того, чем больше игроков в подземелие, и чем они там дольше находятся, тем дороже становиться проход. К примеру, какой-нибудь парень играет сейчас в  подземелие, и он уже нафармил 100 сальтов. Вы зайдя на сервер тоже хотите пойти выбить какую-нибудь шмотку. Вы нафармливаете 3 сальта (стандартная плата за вход) в 1-2 боях с другими игроками,  идете за водопад и резко обнаруживаете, что цена прохода стала 33 сальта, а то и больше. Выход? По факту только один: тупо ждать пока игрок сольется в подземелие и отправиться на респаун. Принимая во внимание тот факт, что игроков в подземелие может быть больше 4, ожидание превращется в прекрасное время препровождения. 

5) Сальты. Или вроде этого. Это денежная единица в игре. Пока что она есть только в Пиксель-лобби. Вы получаете ее за драки с другими игроками (1-2 штучки) или же вы можете фармить ее в Подземелиях (в среднем от 10-15 штук за победу на Хищником). Эта единица нужна чтобы открывать ящики в подземелие. И вот тут-то и кроется весь юмор. А именно сальты не сохранятся. Да -да буквально выйдя из пиксель-лобби сервера и зайдя в него снова вы обнаруживаете что все обнулилось.  И да.. будьте добры - начинайте по-новой.  Т.е. все это сделано, чтобы искусственно удержать игрока, отвлекая его внимание от бессмысленности им совершаемых действий.

6) Жесткий дисбаланс между персонажами. Как все было в механике игры - так и осталось. Олиндер сидящая под облачками магии, и спамящиая один и тот же шар ( твайлайт ) - это так прекрасно ... Аризона спамящая ласом, и бросающая вас из одного угла в другой ... так гениально .. Никогда не видел этого раньге, лол нет

7) Дико дерганная анимация движения, пинг прилагается, противники проходят сквозь ваши атаки и не получают уровна, в отличие от вас, анимация движения губ обоих персов перед началом боя без озвучания, дикая смена интонаций голоса озвучки - особенно в конце боя.  Некоторым персам озвучка вообще не подходит к их характеру (Аризона, Тинху, книга Олиндер это вообще ... )


В общем, игра своих денег не стоит, даже не смотря на тот факт что она в раннем доступе, ибо и так видно не только отношение разработчиков за все эти годы "напряженной" работы, но и то, что игра так и осталась с тем же самым скелетом. Те же движения, те же комбинации, те же больные места - все что поменялось, только визуальный окрас. Даже персонажей придумали не разрабы, а получили наработки со стороны, как и деньги, и время.  И не сделали ничего!  Основной их фишкой было именно Пиксельное лобби, которое просто скучное и в нем нечего делать. Подземелие пустые, ненужные и дисбалансированные на предмет их сложности. В игре нет обучения, нет пояснения как что делать, даже как сменить перса в Пиксельном лобби - до всего приходится додумываться самому.  На старте игры онлайн был почти 1,3 к  человек, сейчас где 300-500 максимум. И скорее всего, он и будет падать, именно из-за отношения разработчиков к проекту. Врядли игру спасет добавление в нее стори-мода или соревновательного режима, ибо проблемы комфортной или хотя бы "справедливой" игры лежат у основания игры. За почти 4 или чуть больше лет, разработчики не сделали ничего на такую сумму денег, а только пиарились тем фактом, что их бедных прижало Хасбро, а дальше снимали сливки от доната сочувствующих и креативных идей других людей.  Скорее всего, в будущем разрабы будут стараться снять максимально профита вводом новых персов за DLC или подобным маркетинговыми идеями. 
Them's Fightin Nerds - это тот же скелет, только на него нацепили новую кожу ... только вот как он ходил криво, так и продолжает.  Это печально ...


3 / 10  и то по балу за Вельвет, Паприку и Олиндер, да и то, это заслуга Лоурен. 
----------------
Писалось на одном дыхание. Орфография и пунктуация сохранены. Больше спасибо.

40426984.review:
First of all: I will edit this review once the game exits the EA state.
I've never played a fighting game (except ARMS, which stole me around 100 hours and MK 9/X, which i only played occasionally with friends), so my experience with this genre is pretty limited, but i feel like TFH is a promising game.
I enjoy it's fighting mechanics (haven't tried multiplayer yet) as they feel "easy to understand, hard to master", but i think the bots are too much punitive on the easiest levels, which isn't bad by itself, it's a good way to improve at the game, but it's probably going to scare most newbies
(as i said, i am not very experienced with 2D fighting games, so i was pretty surprised when the AI bots didn't let me land a single hit on them on Normal the first time, which led me to spend the first hour and half practicing combos and blocking attacks in the Training mode and only the last 30 minutes playing an Arcade game).
The art style is actually pretty inspired, the animations are smooth and the character are really cute, but i think the stages should be less static and more entertaining. Moving over, i really enjoy the musics (i think i'm in love with The Woodlands and Alpake Highlands's background themes), and i appreciate the dynamic music system.

The game isn't perfect, of course:
It lacks some voice lines and animations, stages are too "static" and i feel like there should be a proper tutorial mode that actually teaches the basics (it took me a while to understand how to block attacks, and i'm still not sure if i'm doing it properly), and i think the AI bots need another difficulty setting aimed at players who never did an half moon in their entire life.

Summing it up, i'm quite impressed by how good the game feels (i honestly expected worse), as i said it's a promising product, i'm pretty sure the things i mentioned earlier are going to get fixed soon, as the game is still in early access.

40423539.review: There has been many philosohies about the variety of fighting game difficultes going from iconically simple such as Dive Kick to the technically advanced such as Tekken, Guilty Gear, or many other Eastern fighting games. However, I feel as though Them Fightin' Herds is the perfect balance on the difficulty bar that makes it a lot more fair and welcoming to people that are new to the fighting genre while still providing the depth and technically that inspires fighting game veterans to put in the time to take this game to the competative level. At its curent Early-acess state it is missing a story mode, however there is still plenty of content to enjoy including arcade mode, training mode, target practice, local and online multiplayer pvp, and a feature called pixel lobby in which you can costumize your pixel avatar and join a lobby of other players where you can walk around a 8-bit-like rpg world and interact with the people you are fighting. Before closing this review, I would like to point out that the training mode does have a trials mode within the menu while in training mode that shows the player combos for each of the fighters. This helps a lot before fighting the AI or online players as it shows you a few combos that not only allow for you to get in a few extra hits, but also teaches you the mechanics of each fighter and how to effectively use their kit to your advantage. In conclusion, this game is great as a casual or competitive fighter and fills a gap in the fighting genre that connects both newcommers and veterans to a single game that both groups can enjoy. (Also don't let the art and aesthetics of the game discourrage you from playing it, I personaly don't like MLP or any similar shows, but artistically the game looks beautiful and behind the cute art style is a seriously fun and in-depth fighting game.)

40423016.review:
I have been following this game for years, and It's not that I wouldn't recommend it as I think it's coming along very well, however there are some issues that need to be fixed before I'd recommend purchasing.

PROS:
- The Characters themselves are appealing and well animated in most places.
- Diverse characters and environments.
- Good soundtrack.

CONS:
- The AI is extremely hard to beat. It isn't impossible but very difficult. They block nearly every move you pull and I have had games where I am repeatedly smashed against the wall and can't do anything.
- The inputs for combo attacks (especially super attacks) seem very temperamental. Sometimes I can pull it off instantly, whilst other times I can sit there doing the input over and over again but nothing happens. This happens in both Arcade and Training mode.
- The command list is unclear in places - especially in regards to blocking. It took me a very long time to work out how to block an attack because all the command list showed was attacks that you could do whilst blocking.
- The controls for training mode are complex, which is a good thing in a way, but equally is a little bit confusing - there are a lot of settings with scales from 1-100 but not much indication of what this changes or by how much. Not a huge issue but would be better if it were a bit clearer.
- The characters do not stand out enough from the background in certain environments, making the overall game feel crowded and messy. This is especially problematic when it comes to background characters. Requires a better depth of field to gain a separation from the two.
- The story mode is missing, which is what I would have ideally liked to have played first.


Other notes:
- It would be nice if you could choose the skin your character will have rather than a random selection.
- There is often a delay at the start of the match causing the characters voiceline to be heard before their mouth animation begins.

[i]This game is worth the price tag. You may think I'm just a brony drooling over a successor to a game he wanted to play but never got to, but let me tell you, that's not (most) of the case. 40410958.review:
It's really strong and great to see how a community has come all the way together from what was a simple project from Lauren Fausts previous project into the gaming industry, Fighting is Magic. While the game did get C&C'd it lived on for a few years.

After playing the Beta for a while, I'd have to give on the things which need to be addressed and improved.
The Music has to be the games strongest point of this game, being one of those Dynamic Sync Soundtracks which you rarely see in alot of video games, (Super Mario Galaxy was one of these)
The Graphical quality has picked up, but sometimes it can feel relatively chunky especially on Higher Resolution Screens. This actually just scales the objects higher as it's built on the 720 Resoultion. 

The amount of reference on Skins are noticeable, from Oleanders DJ and Biznis Skin representing the My Little Pony Show. The game takes alot of resources from their previous game which is fairly noticeable for those who followed the work by Freelancers & Mane6 itself and character attacks, which is really great as the Hitboxes are fair and easily able to tell if you are going to hit them or not.

While the game is early access, I can't hestitate a few issues & more suggestions that could make this game benefitial.
The game has a known issue for Crashing while going to and from Windowed to Full screen
Performance issues when Tabbing Out.
Missing Audio from alot of Characters and Lip Syncing is off.
Additonal Controller support for the Bumpers and triggers would be optimal for those who thrive off fighters (I was pushing A + X to grab Alot)

The game starts needs a few Tune ups and fixes
A proper Training mode needs to be introduced, as there is no proper training mode to tell players how to juggle or even launch, while the AI have this Kill feature of pulling off undiscovered combos and techs.
Some nerfs including Hitboxes on ranged Projectiles size need to be fixed up.
Alot of work regarding the character dialogue and syncing needs to happen, it feels like two characters were primarily focused.

It's a beta, but it's great to see a small team work on something so amazing. I can't wait to see how this Project will go.

40408542.review:
If you can look past the visual theme and want a good fighting game, pick this up. I had little to no interest prior to it's release but I owned Skullgirls(which grants you a discount) so I figured,  for 11 bucks it's worth checking out. My mind was almost instantly changed to loving what this game has to offer from a gameplay and feature standpoint. 

- Character variety rivaling that of Guilty Gear and Blazblue. Puppet characters, zoners, hyper aggressive rushdown with fly mechanics, grapplers, you name it. Somehow with just 6 characters the game managed to have more variety and creativity than that of Marvel or Dragonball.

- More training mode features than any AAA fighter out there. Most notably the ability to save and share combos through files that can be then added to your own game with ease and shown on the screen for you to do. 

- Better netcode than most fighters out there(GGPO). Gives you actual ping stats, not just ambiguous bars. GGPO then allows you to also set a delay to better accomate bad connections to make it much more seemless than most fighting games.

- A lobby system that surpasses that of every other game out there, this shit has it's own single player elements woven into the 2d lobby you can run around in. Treasure chests will even appear in this lobby and you can challenge a person trying to open it to see who gets it. The lobbies also feature voice chat and highly accurate ping bars. Which could be toxic and bad for the game, but there is a mute feature and so far nobody has been toxic on the mic to eachother.

- Gameplay is smooth and  intuitive. Combos and moves flow nicely and have enough freedom for higher level players to come up with crazy ways to combo without hurting beginners.

40406275.review:
While there's some presentational issues like lack of polish in animation and sound (Many animations that simply haven't been implimented such as 
only a single frame for characters crouching
Tianhuo's fire
Velvet's super
Arizona being cut off by the announcer stating that she's won, etc.) it seems that these will all be fixed once the game exits bearly access.

The roster is small compared to other games, however personally I don't think it needs more than it currently has. Almost everyone will find a character they're comfortable with, and there's at least one more character to come down the road aswell.

And yes, while the game is early acces the game should have been delayed until full release, but even in the state it exists, in it's a really fun time.

It was very easy for my friends to pick up who haven't really played anything but something like smash bros, at least when I explained the mechanics to them. There's also clearly a room for a lot of higher level play, of course. The unique magic system also helps set the game apart from others of it's ilk.

Outside of gameplay, the game also has more than a few great puns just in the UI and character pallets, so I expect the story mode to continue this trend when that releases, but we'll only be able to tell when it releases.

The music can be underwhelming for a fighting game at times, and at other times the memorable melodies are completely kickass. This is especially true when listening to the music in isolation (though, listening in isolation from the game slightly defeats the point, because of the real-time dynamic music mashups).

Get it if you like fighting games, you want to like fighting games, or you like cool music and puns.

Only played this game for a short while in early access but it needs to be said, this game is really good.

The game is simple enough to be picked up and played by all, but complex enough to where there's a lot to work out. I spend two hours at the start when I intend for only a couple minutes in training mode because I was just learning detail after detail about the character I was playing and I wanted to learn more. 

All 6 characters play drastically different from eachother so there will be a character for most. Juggle decay is fantastic for letting you take unique combos while not sacrificing damage.

The netcode was where we could've ran into problems (I played against someone on a different continent with 150+ ping) but to my surprise, it was lagless. Perfect. 

Artistically, the game looks gourgeous. Animations aren't finished yet, but what is in done in a lovely style by Lauren Faust, artist of MLP as well. Also the music is dynamic, such a little thing, but enough to distinguish it from competition.

Overall, great game, it's progressed well in the years since it's origins as an MLP fan game and I can't wait to see where it goes.

40402733.review:
Product was purchased by and reviewed for Early Access Watcher.

[h1]Welcome to the Robot Maid Review of Them's Fightin' Herds[/h1]

Review of version 0.1 9139Mc

This game is very flawed and you'd expect 5 years of development to have a bit more polish than what we're given.

While the music and graphics don't really do anything for me, but I have nothing personally against it so I won't be criticizing any of those.

As an Early Access game, it's understandable that you only have an Arcade and Online mode and a sparse roster of six characters, so my criticisms won't reflect that either.

The gameplay is the large issue.

Combos are unfilling to learn because damage scaling is so punishing that a 2 hit combo often does as much as or more damage than a 12 hit combo, which also incorporates the aforementioned 2 hit combo. It's entirely possible that damage scaling is bugged, but as of now I have no reason to truly believe that it is.

Furthermore, hitboxes and hurtboxes are deceptive. It may not seem like it'd be a big issue but it causes problems since many hitboxes and hurtboxes are deceptively big or small, you may often see yourself going "Wait, I should've landed that hit" or "how did that hit me? The animation wasn't near me."

These are my primary issues with the game. These faults may be changed in future updates, but as the game stands now, it's just not a good fighting game.

There are better fighting games to spend 15 USD on.

40397031.review:
This is a quick review after playing for a couple of hours.

Short version: 
Even after such a short amount of time I highly recommend Them's Fightin' Herds. Go buy it now.  

Long Version:  
I love fighting games and have done for many years, but not just *any* fighting game will do. I'm happy to say this isn't just a low effort game and I would recommend it to any fan of the genre. Them's Fightin' Herds' (TFH) fighting system isn't breaking new ground, but it has enough features to have it's own feel. It feels kind of like a dialed back anime fighter. There are no air dashes, super jumps or double jumps outside of unique, per character passives. The combo system is the usual Light > Medium > Hard fair, but there are variations based on each characters individual moves. The magic button handles auxiliary special moves and features of each character, somewhat similar to Blazblue's 'Drive' system.

Pros:
-Solid fighting game mechanics.
-Beautiful hand drawn graphics.
-Great net code (GGPO).
-Unique characters.
-Fully, I mean FULLY featured training mode.

Cons:
-Only 6 characters (I think they are adding more later).
-No story mode (as of this review. It is being added later).

Honestly, if you don't mind the small roster and like fighting games, it is well worth the asking price. Bear in mind, the small roster still represents a lot of variety; there are no shoto clones here and you are sure to find a character you enjoy playing. The net code is solid and I've been able to find matches easily and play with minimal lag.

Buy.
This.
Game.

40396689.review:
Игра абсолютно недоделана, не стоит своих денег на данный момент.
Чтобы вы понимали, игра собрала $600.000 шекелей и 5 лет разработки. 

В игре есть 6 персонажей. У всех этих персонажей недоделаны анимации. Отсутствуют звуковые дорожки.
В игре отсутствует баланс
В игре поломаны все менюшки, даже выбор персонажа и локации для драки.
В игре отсутствует сюжетка, туториал, быстрые матчи и рейтинг.
В игре вместо отсутствующей анимации показывают статическую сине-белую картинку, не раскрашенную или вообще ничего не показывают и персонаж просто совершает действие.

Как вы поняли, если принимать тот факт, что игра на самом деле не делалась 6 месяцев, а в 10 раз дольше. Что она стоила больше половины миллиона долларов, то понимаешь что разработчики просто кинули своих игроков и забрали все деньги себе и накалякали на коленке за 3 месяца игру, чтобы собрать еще больше в стиме.

Думаю в стиме очень много положительных отзывов только по причине того, что игроки боятся потерять онлайн, т.к. без него ИГРА ПО СЕТИ просто умрет.

J'ai eu ce jeu day-one, et je n'ai pas été déçu. J'ai peut-être été surpris quand j'ai appris que Humble Bundle en était l'éditeur (je les pensais pas ainsi), mais dans un sens je me suis dit que des éditeurs comme ça produirait forcément des bons jeux, et Them's Fightin' Herds en est un très bon exemple. Dommage cependant que je n'ai pas participer au financement du projet.
Tant qu'on y est, parlons-en : je trouve qu'en laissant la beta disponible avant la sortie à toutes les personnes qui ont participer au financement du projet (si j'ai bien compris comment ça marchait), Mane6 prend un gros risque. En effet, au moment de la sortie, ces joueurs peuvent revenir sur la version officiel et mettre une raclée aux joueurs qui ne se sont pas encore entraîner (ça m'arrive souvent).

Bilan : 7/10
Un jeu très coloré dans lequel je prends beaucoup de plaisir à jouer, même quand il s'agit de me faire défoncer comme un gros noob par d'autres joueurs. Et à ce niveau-là, je pense qu'un système de leaderboard un poil plus explicite dans les lobbys au moins serait la bienvenue.

40394409.review:
Don't be fooled by the colorful graphics or innocent looking critters, TFH packs a punch.

The gameplay feels like a cross between Skullgirls and Street Fighter, with interesting combo possibilities but more footsie (or hoovsie?) based, and the Lab Zero Engine definitely brings the game to a whole new level.

TFH is a strong, worthy addition to the fighting game genre, and i hope it will be featured in many fighting game events starting from this year.

40394310.review:
Okay, time for a first-impression review.

+ The game is fabulous. Excelent graphical fidelity.
+ The gameplay is super smooth. Except when it's not.
+ The magic meter and ex-meter are a good idea. 
+ The AI is hard and will teach careful play

- No tutorial whatsoever. I have to elaborate on this, since playing against the bots, you can see them use mechanics that are not explained anywhere. If the game would even list these, it would be passable, but it doesn't. Push-blocking at least seems to be pretty damn prevalent and is not actually explained. Hell, the game doesn't even tell you if there's a throw function. 
- The AI is hard. As in NRS levels of bad in input reading. It's super frustrating for it to react instantly with a ground/air throw on wakeup. 
- It's really early, but a roster of 6 is not good in any shape or form.
- I guess there's audio desync or something in the animations? The characters are talking and sound is coming out seconds before.

Fighting Herds is has promise, but it's not worth the money YET. Fix your tutorials, fix your little bugs and expand the roster a bit and we'll talk. I predict this game will have a similar cult following like Skullgirls. Hell, I think it will be better than Skullgirls eventually!

But for now, I will wait.

40390945.review:
Well designed visuals running on a well made engine for 2D fighters with animated visuals. Excellent music, although I'm not really a fan of the announcer. It's clear that they have at this point in early access, they have all the characters running properly, and the only things left to finish are the visuals, sound, and polish (such as the menus, which are pretty barebones right now).
I'm guessing this won't be in early access for too long, and a 25% discount never hurt anyone. I'd say once this leaves EA it'll be an excellent game for people who are beginners to fighters, such as myself, as it's pretty much a 4 button Skullgirls.
And for those worried about it not leaving EA, these devs got C&D'd and that didn't stop them. I doubt they'd give up now after all they've been through.
[b]TL;DR - New to fighting games? Want a good entry point? Like cute animals fighting each other? Want to try a simpler fighter that isn't just barebones unga bunga? This might just be what you're looking for![/b]

40389309.review:
A most peculiar game. Though it has the stigma of being a "MLP" game, about the only connection left at this point is that the current roster has obvious ties to the show's main characters.

I believe the best thing to start with is that the game is paradoxically simple and complex. But in a good way. The simple part comes in from having a basic three attack + unique skill button layout and being chock full of simple easy to use commands(no 360 inputs here!). That said, the combo system used here is the same style as Skull Girls allowing comboes to get quite lengthy and there is also a "Magic" meter one must be aware of on top of their super meter which is critical for many of their moves.

It also pulls off some fairly interesting design choices regarding supers. Typically, characters either have one or multiple supers that are performed with various commands typically with a multibar munching one that is extra powerful. TFH instead takes a newley tread middle ground by sticking supers inside other supers. For example, Arizona has a ramming attack for a super, but with an extra super bar, she can tack on an additional high powered kick. For other characters though, it tends to be a bit more intersting. Paprika can intterupt her super to plop down a picnic basket and then use that as either an escape tool or a way to spam projectiles, Pom can abort the final hit of her super to instead keep a giant dog around for a while and have him attack on command, Oleander simmilarly can end her super early to unleash "Fred" and gain access to many new attacks, etc.

Oh and it's quite pretty too. The pixel lobby in particular is just adorable.

40385481.review:
The game strikes an excellent balance between the mechanical simplicity of games like Street Fighter and the deeper systems of games like Blazblue. It isn't as overwhelming as Guilty Gear or even Blazblue for beginners, and is an excellent entry-level fighting game while maintaining enough depth to satisfy more dedicated fighting game players. The game's aesthetic and overall structure is cohesive and satisfying, and the characters are portrayed and animated beautifully.

At such a modest price point, especially for Skullgirls owners, I would recommend Them's Fightin' Herds anyone with even a vested interest in fighting games. The promise of more content and characters even after the full release is icing on the cake.

40378942.review:
Definitely a disapointment.  While I love the world and the characters and the animation (though it still needs work), I can't say I am a big fan of the combat system. The system is very slow and tactile and easily rewards turtling. I am used to Guilty Gear and Arc System Work's combat systems that are fast and frenetic, punishes you for turtling, and rewards offensive players. The combat system in this game is the exact opposite.

Other than that, it has all the obvious flaws you would expect from a game in early access (static backgrounds, no story mode, lack of achievements etc.) So it really comes down to preference. If you must have this game, wait for it to be finished if you can.

40378809.review: 花了点时间摸了一下系统，我这边呢，建议大家先把按键系统设置好在体验游戏，假如玩过拳皇13的朋友都知道按键设置非常蛋疼，花了很长时间才搞懂怎么设置，TFH也是如此，大家设置的时候先把2P的设置一遍然后再设置1P的，不然等着手忙脚乱吧。游戏虽然仍然在体验阶段，但是游戏内容值得去游玩，FIM的招式大部分都可以用在TFH上，而且连击体验更好，没有那种无脑连，毕竟系统比FIM完善了，联机系统还没试，不过听玩过的朋友说体验极佳，还有服务器可以创建，可容纳最多20人的存在，确实非常好了，劳伦的第一次游戏作品可以说打个9.9分都没问题，好了，我的评测就这么多，大家自己去体验吧。

Игра отличная, играл в нее еще когда она была Fighting is magic. Классная графика, разнообразие геймплея (в ФАЙТИНГЕ, ЛОЛ!!), МУУУУУУУЗЗЗЫЫЫЫЫКАААААААААААА,
какая же охуенная музыка  в этой игре, это просто пиздец. Но музыка не основной ее плюс. 
Сам геймплей тоже охуенен. Игра определенно стоит своих денег, и оправдывает ожидания ТОЛЬКО В САМОМ НАЧАЛЕ!!!!!! Разработчик постарался на славу, хотя у него еще все впереди. Надеюсь он не оплошает и доделает игру.

(ДОПОЛНЕНИЕ)
Однако, у игры есть и свои минусы. Отсутствие тренировки. Тебя как бы пускают сразу либо в онлайн либо в аркаду к злющим ботам, которых хер убьешь не умея играть за персонажа. Баланс хромает, РДшка (ну или то что ей являлось раньше) на нечестном выебет в жопу даже самого скиллованного игрока как минимум раза 3, прежде чем он сможет ее победить. Вельвет имеет огромный, я бы даже сказал ДИЧАЙШИЙ урон. Пом наверное самая слабая в игре. Про Олеандер вообще молчу.
Но все эти минусы могут быть убраны, ведь, я надеюсь, разработчик занимается игрой. Вообщем пока сыровато, но играть можно.

40375413.review:
Very fun, full of personality, and packed with helpful training mode features (such as the feature to record your own combo and use it in a custom combo trial). It's a passion project with quite a history, now in good shape with Lauren Faust and Tara Strong on board. The only problem so far is that the pixel lobby has some unintuitive controls. I had to Google how to use the chat (click the chat box with your mouse) and ask how to change characters (left/right while in the wardrobe menu). Those are some pretty big oversights in an otherwise very well crafted interface.

Most if not all of the alternate color swaps are cool references to things. I like Deku Oleander, Spyro Tianhuo, and Pet Shop Velvet.

40369692.review:
This is definitely an early access game - not all animations are implemented, mouth movment and voice don't sync, and story mode does not exist. There are only 6 characters.

So why do I recommend this game? It is a solid, well paced, casual oriented fighter based on the skullgirls engine. The inputs are simple but the fundamentals feel strong. The cast feels surprisingly diverse for the limited roster, and most fighters have an entertaining personality. The unusual aesthetic of cutesy 4 legged creatures is refreshing, but familiar enough that it isn't offputting. The music is good and, because this is a game based (however loosely) on MLP, the player base skews more friendly than most fighting games.

Add in pixel lobbies with dungeon runs for cosmetic items and you have the makings of a pretty fun community. I haven't had this much fun just jumping into online MP well.. ever! So while this game definitely needs some work, I find that the price is reasonable for what you get. I recommend experiencing this game now, while the community is new and as active as it is likely to get. The more the merrier and you can skill-up along with everyone else.

The graphics are solid and pretty to look as well being able to run on anything. (Tried it on my laptop.)
Fighting engine is similar to skullgirls so any SG will be destroying you with a few hours of training or less. As a bounus each fighter has a different style so it won't one input fits a few characters like some other games.
Online battles are smooth and rage free enviorment at the moment so there are no rage quitters in my playtime so far.
The odd thing for me is that I'll have to get use to the 4 button layout rather than 6. Best part is, even if this game wasn't based off of MLP, you'd still have a good time. Cheers.

IF you're a new a player with no background, please do some practice before going online. Everyone there is a just a savage or a closet beast.

40364507.review:
I've been playing fighters for basically my entire life, stemming from the Street Fighter Alpha series, Tekken 2 and 3, Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3, and pretty much everything that came out after. I also have a natural knack for these kinds of games. A few minutes in training mode to fiddle around with the characters and mechanics, and I'm basically ready to compete with high skill level players.

Fast forward to somewhere in 2012 and Skullgirls is released, and I have to say, it's been my favorite fighting game the day I downloaded it on my Xbox 360 even until now. I can go on about why it's the perfect fighting game, at least from my perspective, but this isn't a Skullgirls review.

While Skullgirls is arguably the best indie fighting game ever made, Them's Fightin' Herds has potential to be the next indie fighter powerhouse. It may be it's close resemblance to Skullgirls in which that it uses the same engine as it, or the hand drawn characters, or the GGPO netcode, but those are all things that made these games spectacular. I've only been playing for a few hours, but it's held my attention more than any fighter that came out since Skullgirls, and that's why I'm certain that this game will proseper. That is, if the devs keep up with it, which they seem like they are.

This is in early access, so obviously there are going to be bugs, there are going to be modes missing, there aren't going to be many characters, so critiquing the game being unfinished would be just plain foolish. The game is playable, the online is smooth, and it's just plain fun. If you like 2D 4-button juggle heavy fighters, Then this game is for you.

Also I'm not a brony by any means.

This game isn't specifically for bronies. 

You don't have to be a brony to buy this game.

It's been a long, long time since I picked up a fighting game that wasn't FighterZ and immediately fell in love with its presentation, character designs, character mechanics, and overall polish despite being an early access game that's still not done.

I can't wait to see what else they add to this game because for the short time I've spent with it so far I've had an absolute blast. The way that all six characters have their own bizarre systems and mechanics and methods of generating "magic", which is a secondary resource separate from your typical super meter, feels very reminiscent of ArcSys games like Guilty Gear, Persona 4 Arena Ultimax, BlazBlue, and etc, which has me excited to see all the character specific tech I can either work out for myself or find out from other players!

40360889.review:
It's hard to believe this game even came out after such a long time but here we are, the equine fighter everyone was waiting for is playable on Steam.
As a fighting game it's hard to classify. We're into anime-marvelish territory but without 3v3 and without universal movement like runs, super jumps or air dashes (each of these are available only to specific characters). It probably reminds more of Darkstalkers 3/Vampire Savior than anything else.

Pros:
- amazing GGPO netcode directly from the Skullgirls engine
- fantastic training mode with lots of options (also thanks to SG)
- fluid and responsive gameplay
- a funny approach to online lobbies with a co-op PvE mode called "salt mines" where players can fight against AI characters to gain salt (the in-game currency)
- a dynamic BGM that changes according to which characters are playing and who's winning the round
- some nice extras if you own some other fighting games on Steam

Cons:
- small roster of characters
- still many placeholder animations
- character movement feels a little too slow and limited regardless of who you're playing
- few ways to spend EX meter
- very few online lobbies for regions that aren't NA or Europe
- not many ways to spend salt for now
- salt doesn't carry over different lobbies
- lobby commands are still a little unintuitive
- only one lobby layout and only 6 avatars available
- no story mode yet

If you're not afraid of a few bugs (which will very likely be fixed) and you like fighting games, by any means try this game. It's very cheap too.

40352478.review:
Them's Fighting Herds beweist zwei Sachen. Nummer 1: Egal wie viele Stolpersteine man Leuten in den Weg legt, wenn sie sich reinhängen und beweisen, dass es ihnen wirklich am Herzen liegt, dann schaffen sie so ziemlich alles. Nummer 2: Ich bin immernoch grottig in Prügelspielen.

Them's Fighting Herds ist ein einsteigerfreundliches, über Crowdfunding finanziertes und über Humble Bundle gepublishtes Prügelspiel mit einer Besetzung aus niedlichen, vierbeinigen Tieren. Das Projekt hat eine ziemlich interessante Vergangenheit: Gestartet als My Little Pony-Fanprojekt "Fighting is Magic" nahm es fahrt auf, bevor es kurzerhand durch ein C&D von Hasbro vom Himmel geholt wurde. Daraufhin schaltete sich Lauren Faust, die Schöpferin der fröhlich-freudigen G4-Ponys, ein und griff dem Team vom Mane6 unter die Arme, indem sie Charaktere für das Spiel designte. Eine erfolgreiche Crowdfunding-Kampagne und einen Alpha-Test später, und uns steht die Early-Access-Fassung gegenüber. Mit der Ankündigung, mehr Content und den Story-Modus zu implementieren, lohnt sich das Spiel für 15€ zuzeit, wenn man einfach nur mal mit einer wütenden Rehntier-Dame eine Kuh mit Western-Akzent volles Pfund aufs Maul geben wollt. Allen anderen rate ich, sich die Fortschritte erst einmal anzusehen. Da ich selbst die turbulente Geschichte dieses Projektes verfolgt habe, bin ich ziemlich sicher, dass Mane6 die Entwicklung konsequent durchziehen wird.

40347722.review:
I'm having so much fun with the fights, even when I lose. The game is encouraging when it comes to trying to improve. There isn't a tutorial yet, but there are people in the pixel lobbies who are more than willing to teach new players. I started out as a complete novice and got someone to teach me the basics. Pretty soon I was doing some basic ABC combos, blocking, pushblocking, etc.

If you are willing to learn then don't worry, just press buttons and have fun. You can also ask other new players to practice with you which happens quite a bit.

You also have the option to enter training mode with another player, giving you both access to the many training options available. This way, you can set both health bars to infinite and not worry about winning and losing.

Now for anyone who read this, I will reward you with a cookie of sorts. While playing as Arizona or Velvet, try mashing the down key while in a fight ;)

40347123.review:
As someone who hasn't played many fighting games, this one is much more approachable than other titles in the same genre (Blazblue, Sreet Fighter, etc.)

The learning curve is still fairly steep if you want to actually play competitively, but if you take a few hours to learn the combos, you'll find that reaching a decent skill level won't take nearly as much time as you'd expect. The controller's back bumpers and triggers aren't even used in combat, so all you have to worry about is making the correct joystick movements, and knowing which of the 4 buttons to press at any given time.

There's no proper tutorial included yet, but you can find every combo you'll need to know in the training menu, and from there, it's just trial and error. It might take awhile before you're ready to face actual human opponents, especially if you're inexperienced, but there's plenty of people in the lobbies who are eager to help new players practice and hone thier skills.

Them's Fightin' Herds has a real future as a competitive fighting game, but it still has a long way to go. There are only 6 characters right now, and many options and game modes are missing. The dev team has stated that they'll be ready for a full release in a few months though, so we can expect the game to be more fleshed out then. As of now, the core gameplay is solid, and every character has a distinct playstyle to suit any preference; so the foundation is there. Can't wait to see the end result.

I don't know what I'm more shocked by.  The incredible production quality, the fact that an indie title is mechanically more fun and more of a "real" fighting game than the latest Team Red entry from Arcsys, or the fact that despite the first two - the game is developed around an IP based around a cartoon for little girls.

10/10 - Go in with an open mind and don't judge the game based on what it's not, and more importantly what it's not trying to be.  Theres no way in hell you're going to be disappointed.

Worthy mention - this game's stun system is the most intuitive and non intrusive comeback factor I've seen in a fighting game.  I'd hate to use the term "fair", but it fits perfectly in this context.

40344953.review:
[h1] If you can wait for it, wait for it.[/h1]
There's a variety of reasons I can say that it's a great game, but at the moment there's a lot of weird issues that shouldn't be happening.
The game was set to release in full the same day it came out in early access, and 2 days before the release date they announced the game would be releasing without story mode. 

While fine, there's a few issues with this. It seems the build up at the moment, is one that must be quite a while back in development. There are multiple things that are definitely not release quality other than story mode missing. Many characters have fill-in animations, much of the UI feels odd, and even intro animations in battles are wonky and unfinished.

However, if you really don't care about these problems, and trust the developer to patch these issues, as they claim they will do soon, then the game itself is great and solid for the most part.

The game plays as some kind of weird amalgamation of Guilty gear and Blazblue, with a hint of skullgirls feel. The game has a Light, medium, heavy, and a Magic/Gimmick button. Each character has a 'magic' bar in addition to their super meter, somewhat similar to the V-System in Street Fighter V. Every character gains magic in different ways, some over time, others by confirming certain moves.


Pros!
+The 6 characters feel varied, and feel unique to each other in their playstyles.
+The movement and combo flow is extremely fluid and feels great and intuitive once you get practice in. 
+Match-ups seem, at least at face value, mostly evenly matched, and it seems like no character has anything more than a 6-4 matchup on another.
+The game's training mode, as it is Skullgirl's heavenly Z-Engine, is amazingly robust and has plenty to work with for practice.
+Pixel Lobby system s'alright, and there is a private lobby system as well.
+I haven't played the Salt Mines mode yet in the Pixel Lobbies, but from what I've seen and heard it's decently fun
+The music in the game alone is great, but the dynamic music system adds to an already great soundtrack. It swells and calms down at appropriate moments, and seems to decently follow the pace of the match. Mostly.
+The animations look and feel great on many of the characters and their attacks, and have a lot of personality to them.
+The character designs are 'unique' and have a nice artstyle to accompany them.


Edit: The first patch has gone out and fixed some of these issues, I've marked them with a @, and moved them lower.


Cons!
         -Intros and Victories are so horribly bugged and painful, it kinda deflates a victory. Many of the intros will only have 1 character talking, their mouths flapping at random after they finish their line, while the other is silent but mouthing words. Then, an odd pause later the fight countdown will start. Same with victories.
     -There is no where NEAR enough lines for characters and their intros/victories. It seems like most have maybe 2 or 3, and some of them will cut themselves off, like Arizona's victory. She has only 3 victory lines, which are all terribly out of sync with her talking, and one of them completely stops at the last line. "Kickin', Stompin', and Ki-" gets real old, real fast.
     -While in theory this would be a good and simple game to have beginners in the fighting game genre start with, there is absolutely no tutorial of any kind for even basic game mechanics. Even the combo trials for the game are hidden inside of training, in the training options.
     @-Hot damn that AI is a piece of shit.It's understandable that AI in fighting games are always gonna be BS. atleast in some way, this game takes it back to the Mortal Kombat 3 era of enemies being absolute brickwalls with perfect punish strings. It doesn't help the AI isn't even set to Normal by default, it's set to Competent (Hard, essentially) @The AI is now set to normal by default, and it seems to not be so godly at defense and combos. They still occasionally do insane combos after a punish, but fighting a zoner AI won't make you want to bite through your own jaw.
     @-Damage numbers feel incredibly wonky. As Arizona, a standard bread and butter (Gatling>Launcher>Special>Level1Super) does an okay amount of damage, but heavies from other characters seem to do as much as the simple combos I've figured out so far. It's possible this is on me, but it does feel unfair that a single projectile from Velvet does as much as a standard gatling gun combo. @After playing a bit more, I think I figured out what my problem was, I was fighting a mirror match in practice, and Arizona has a bit more health than others, so after optimizing my combos a bit and trying them on other characters with lower health, it looks like they're mostly fine.
      @-The art assets on a few stages and characters are absolutely ABYSSMAL. Arizona, on her front fore leg facing the camera on any color that has a splotch, shows that it's almost barely attached to her skin. This is especially bad since her default design has this issue, and colors with monotone colors look better than the default. Some parts of the background stages, specifically the characters, are pixelated to hell and back. @Arizona still has that odd floating splotch, but I can't seem to find any background characters like I saw before the patch with horrible pixels on them.

If you're looking for a good fighting game, and you're not stopped by a lack of polish and even essential features, this game will do great as a budget title.

40344591.review:
So I found out about this game and it's history 2 or 3 weeks ago. I bought it day 1 for my girlfriend and I because she loves MLP (and she's been following this game loosely since Fighting is Magic apparently), I love fighting games, and we both love games in general. Despite this being in early access the game is super fun and features some surprisingly technical mechanics (also the dynamic music is great). As a fighting game fan I am highly impressed by Mane 6's work here and am definitely looking forward to the progress this game will exhibit.

Don't be fooled by the cute aesthetic, this game is pretty legit. Also running on the Z-Engine which was developed by Lab Zero Games for Skullgirls (another fantastic 2D fighter btw) and it clearly shows.

I'm in no way even remotely a fan of MLP. But this is just a fun game I could recommend to any casual or hardcore fighting game fans. If you have any questions/concerns and whatnot leave a comment and I will gladly try and answer with the best of my ability.

So what are you waiting for? Stampede!!


P.S. - If you're put off by the early access and unfinished aspects that is fully understandable but I would encourage you to at least consider purchasing after it has been completed.

40341726.review:
This is one of those games that I tentatively recommend. It's well put together with great visuals, music, and even character design, but it also lacks what a good fighting game should have: a decent roster. Now, I understand the direction to an extent, they wanted to make a smaller cast of more unique fighters instead of a bunch of interchangeble ones like how most fighting games end up having it, and in that regard, they succeeded. The six fighters present at launch do fill very different niches well, but the thing is, that's still only six fighters in the roster. Even Skullgirls, a game that went a similar route with its roster, still had eight characters from the start, and many more added later.
So then, even with the one chracter planned to be added to Fightin' Herds, that still only gives us seven, and six or seven fighters does not create a very varied match expierence. With only six fighters, I expect the game to grow stale quickly, and thus I think it's only a good purchase on signifigant sale. I'd say at least 25% off.

40341489.review:
It's funny, it's cute, the music is phenomenal, the fighting is fun and easy to get into. The character roster may be a tad small, but the current six characters are each unique and have different playstyles, not to mention the pallette references, oh the pallette references. Also, I don't care what you've heard, you don't have to be a fan of any cartoon show to appreciate this game. 

The game also uses the Z-Engine, which you may have heard of from Lab Zero and their game, Skullgirls, who helped the devs of Them's Fightin Herds, Mane6, by letting them use the Z-Engine here. 

Currently it includes a single player arcade mode, training and target mode, with story mode currently being worked on to be released soon in episodic format for free. Multiplayer modes include a lobby play function, and the pixel lobby, which is essentially a lobby with avatars from which you can challenge other players to 1v1 fights, and get cosmetic hats in the pve salt mines. 

The Game's lore is also fairly interesting (the lore info is on Mane6's website) as well as the overall aesthetic of both the characters and world. The world and characters are somewhat adorable, but that doesn't detract from the fighting by no means. For those of you out there who are fans of a certain TV Show.....y'all might be interested to know that Lauren Faust helped to design the characters and world as well. 

Now, to end this review on a high note, allow me to just ask you a simple question

What other game allows you to play as a headbanging cow or sorceress with a necronomicon on the same engine as Skullgirls for ONLY 15 dollars? None? I thought so. 

Also

Oleander is best Po-I mean Ungulate 10/10

40340444.review:
It has the potential to become a fantastic fighting game if it's given the right support.

Them's fightin' herds is a 2D fighter that works with a four button scheme. There are only six fighters so far, move sets & inputs aren't complicated to perform as one would think. And to make it better, the movesets themselves are as simplistic as UMVC3. despite the fact there's not a 2v2 or 3v3 mode, that makes picking one of these characters to main even easier as opposed to being forced to pick 3 members, then an assist move for each.
Right now the arcade mode, target mode, and practice mode are the only things you can do locally, but then there's online. Is the netcode for online good? YES. I most framerate drop I ever experiecned was maybe 2-3 frames during online fight. To give you some perspective, Street fighter 5...it has moments it drops 7+ frames making awkward skips in the battle to catch up. So for the most of the game, you'll be playing in lobbies online.
The lobbies themselves are these cute pixel area's to walk around in. As far as finsing items or cosmetics, i have no clue. haven't spent enough time out there. But its more entertaining than looking at a menu screen to say the least.
Since the game is only a day old, running into other people is always there. And until the game progresses enough and the community surrounding it grows, there won't be many them's fightin herds tourney's or locals of any kind.
Its clear that competition is in mind from the devs. there is just yet to be enough time for things to be worked into the game. If your so worried, keep in mind, its an indie game in early access. it'll get there someday.

The game is in early access as in, WOW you can be reminded of that easily with some drops in framerate, the occasional crash, or lip syncing not working.
For the most part, the only bugs I encountered were those, and with one I hope is only a visual hit box not aapearing in training mode. 
It also supports the use of fight sticks, which came at some surprise. I expected it to require me to go into a menu and switch controllers and remap the controls along with dealing input lag, but no. I put it in, click. and its good.

For those who want to take it seriously, just play online for awhile and lets work to build a community around this game. Thats the healthiest thing for any fighter.
until the game gets fleshed out some more, to later be a full release, I give Them's fightin herds
7/10

40338288.review:
아직 많이 미완성이지만 꽤 재밌습니다.

파이팅 이즈 매직이라는 MLP 팬 게임에서 시작된 이 게임은 당시 게임에 사용된 '격투 게임 만들기 2k3 엔진'의 한계에서 쥐어짜듯이 만들어진 구성을 '스컬걸즈 엔진'을 통해 재구성되었습니다.

당시에도 단순한 커맨드나 조작에서 시작되어 복잡한 콤보로 이어지는 구성을 가지고있었는데, 이게 단조로운거같으면서도 복잡합니다.

필살기는 변칙적 요소에 가깝고 오히려 기본기를 기반으로 얼마나 상대를 잘 두들겨패느냐가핵심이라고 봅니다.

특히 픽셀 로비(결투용 멀티플레이)가 매우 잘되어있습니다.

핑이 150~300씩 차이나도 추천 설정대로 잘 지정해놓으면 아무런 랙없이 가능하다는게 놀랍습니다.

물론 vpn인지 알수없는 중국인지 뭔지 알수없는 인간들의 경우 핑이 미친듯이 튀어서 300이라고 써있는데 실제론 300이아닌... 지옥을 경험하게 만듭니다. 즉 핑이 미친듯이 튀지않고 잘 유지되는게 중요한듯함니다

그리고 픽셀 로비가 현재는 하나만 지원되고있는데, 맵이 여러개로 예정되어있습니다. (아마 각 캐릭터들 테마 맵인듯)

그리고 이 픽셀 로비 맵은 각 맵마다 미니 게임이있는데, 현재 맵의 미니게임은 '탐험' 이라서 격투게임에서 신선한 독특한 구조의 룰을 가진 플레이를 가능하게합니다.

룰이 꽤 재밌는데, 미니 게임 하는 큰 이유는 로비 치장템때문이라 보면 되겠네여 치장템이 종류가 생각보다 많고 병맛스러운것도 많아서 맞추는맛이 있습니다. (거대 오렌지 대가리, 졸라 큰 상어가 머리통을 물어뜯고있는거나, 그냥 평범한 동물 귀달린(???) 고글이나 수염같은...)


한번더 강조하자면 미완성인게 좀 많이 심합니다.
스토리 모드같은건 준비중이라고 알곤있었지만
스프라이트가 러프 상태인것도 많고, 캐릭터간 대사도 없고, 그외에 진짜 온갖 잡다한 디테일에서 러프하게 마무리되어있는게 있습니다.

9시간동안 두들겨패느라 비몽사몽하다보니 횡설수설하지만 써야할거같아서 일단 써씀니다... 크킄...!! 이제 자야지.

40338143.review:
This may be the first fighting game I actually love. Even though I have played games like Street Fighter, Marvel vs Capcom, Mortal Kombat, Skullgirls, and Soulcalibur to name a few, none of those games really held my interest for very long, even if I liked some of them. Now in comes TFH and changes my outlook on fighting games forever.

Pros:
- Cute and charming characters that can appeal to all audiences
- Extensive training modes to help you understand how to play from beginner to master
- Incredible variety in character skins. Nowhere have I seen so many alt colors for characters
- Varying difficulty levels
- Wonderful soundtrack
- Lag-free online matches

Cons: (as of this writing)
- Incomplete animations
- Menus can be confusing to navigate
- Some bugs
- Only six characters (but there will be more in the future)
- Missing story and CPU vs mode

Overall, in its current state, I give the game an 8/10 with the potential to go higher in the near future. Get this game!

40337834.review:
Любителям файтингов: смело можете брать, если стилистика вас не пугает. А она шикарна. Нарисовано всё отлично! Так вот, это стопроцентный файтинг со всем что в нём должно быть и даже больше. Режим истории будет в жанре рпг. Пока его ещё нет, мало известно как это будет реализовано. Сейчас режим аркады, тренировки ( с обширными настройками и комботренингом с обширными настройками), режим мишеней ( попадать ударами оп целям) и сетевой режим.  Теперь про боевую систему. Ударов тут три обычных и один магический. Супер удары тоже присутствуют. Комбо достаточное количество. Фишкой игры является наличие одинаковых приёмов для всех персонажей, что упрощает заучивание. Привыкать к механике управления придётся, но потом вы будете делать всё максимально интуитивно! Комбо прописаны великолепно! А каждый персонаж не только не похож на другого, все они не похожи ни на одного персонажа из файтинг игр. 
Озвучка заслуживает похвалы! Например единорожка с книгой бьёт тёмной магией и произносит: "DIE!", грубым голосом. А в тренировке комбо, если не получилось его прожать, то персонаж скажет: "Damn!", или что-нибудь в таком духе. 
Резюмирую. 
Игра полностью стоит своих денег. Это полноценный файтинг. Это что-то новое в плане идеи. Потенциал огромный! 
Хотелось бы видеть в игре не только копытных животных, но и других! Очень надеюсь на хорошее развитие проекта! Спасибо, разработчики!

40336006.review:
[h1]My Little Blazblue: Azure is Magic[/h1]


Just kidding.

First off, if you are like me and you do not like MLP and/or the style of overly cutely-drawn animals, that is perfectly fine.

This game is a surprisingly technical 2D fighter, but not quite as technical as Blazblue, Guilty Gear, or many other more competative 2D fighters. It's probably one of the better ones to start out with too since it has the common light, medium, heavy, and special attack buttons, and other functions like grabbing is a combination of two of the buttons, but none of the complex mechanics that can overwhelm newer players.

This is clearly an Early Access review, and at this point in time (one day after it's Early Access release) it definitely seems like within the next few months this game will be more than complete, by which I mean they will continually add free story mode expansions.

Right now, there are 6 characters, no story mode, but the arcade and online (using unexpectedly-fun Pixel Lobby) modes work completely fine. So far only one character has a couple missing animations, and they have place-holders which just look like stick figures, but before you roll your eyes over this fact it honestly doesn't change gameplay whatsoever and after seeing it once you know that the placeholder does it's job very well. Right now it's definitely playable and a good idea to do so if you like learning new games early/watching the growth and development of certain games. For me, 2D fighters are my favorite game genre so I'll enjoy watching this one improve.


If you have played any 2D fighters made by Arc System Works, this is specifically directed towards you: If you took Blazblue and just removed air-grabs, air-dashing, double jumps, super (high) jumps, recovery rolls, barrier guard, Burst/Overdrive icon, and Astral Heat, you would essentially have this game.

40334790.review:
Ждал я эту игру достаточно долго и сейчас могу сказать: не зря.
TFH полностью оправдала мои ожидания, пусть даже она всё ещё в раннем доступе.

С первых минут игры видно, что разработчики подошли к созданию данной игры с душой, а участие при этом Лорен Фауст - определённо ещё один плюс. Голоса персонажей приятные, анимация красивая и аккуратная, цвета не режут глаз, интерфейс понятный и не нагружает экран. Особенно порадовало пиксельное лобби, эдакий PonyTown. 

Геймплей на стадии раннего доступа, как я считаю, проработан полностью. Комбо, хоть по отдельности они и простые, требуют некоторого мастерства для их идеального отыгрывания. Я играл только с клавиатуры, так как геймпада у меня нет, и могу сказать, что управление удобное. Также есть возможность назначить 2 макроса на одновременно прожимание некоторых из 4 клавиш атаки, что еще упрощает некоторые комбо. Раньше я никогда особо не играл в игры подобного жанра и не совсем знаком с ним, но вполне доволен геймплеем.

Также хочется отметить широкие возможности для тренировки и отрабатывания комбо: в игре присутствует обширный комбо-тренинг с подробным указанием когда и что нажимать и список приёмов. Для меня, как для новичка жанра, это особо важно. Этот тренинг может дополняться игроками, заметил функцию создания собственных комбо.

Для игроков с высоким пингом реализована задержка фреймов, что делает геймплей более гладким. Мультиплеер уже на стадии раннего доступа полностью играбельный, разве что ранговый режим ещё недоступен. В лобби даже есть войсчат.
Также доступна игра вдвоём на одной клавиатуре.
 
Из недостатков я заметил только высокий пинг на официальных лобби, но это проблема полностью с моей стороны и поэтому на оценку игры она не повлияла.
Также хотелось бы приобрести отдельно саундтрек, потому что он отличный.

В итоге мы получили ПОЛНОСТЬЮ играбельный продукт, а с учётом того, что после выхода из раннего доступа в данный момент недоступная половина контента будет доделана, TFH определенно стоит своих денег. Советую купить её даже тем, кто не знаком с брони-культурой, но по каким-то причинам заинтересовался (основной наплыв идёт именно брони, потому что разработчики делают игру в основном для них, это доказывает их первый проект)

10 непрожавшихся супер-ударов из 10

40334279.review:
This is the game you want if you're a new player to fightning games! 

[h1]Overview[/h1] 
[b]Them's Fightn' Herds[/b] is your normal 2D fightning game. Except it's filled with animals to fight with as opposed to humans or mutants. The game's controls are [u]really really easy[/u] to pick up and play. That means if you're fairly new to playing games like Skull girls this is a breeze. Otherwise, You the new player, does not need to sweat it, just learn the moves first and make sure you have a controller to play with. There isn't too much to hightlight in general since it's still [u]subject to change[/u].

[h1]Adorable Characters w/ Voice!!![/h1]
Each character has their own unique voice and playstyle. Although, they are adorable to to play around with they all have pretty simple combos to use against players. Others having their unique playstyle to combo and their pretty nice defensive moves. This allows you to easily counter players who have you stun locked and give them a nice surprise!

[h1]Multiplayer![/h1]
The game has split screen support and online multiplayer lobbies called "Pixel Lobby". It has a similar layout to "Pony Town" the online flash game, but it allows you to dress your characters and fight with them. The lobby has enemies to fight NPCs as well and an easy to use chat the system.

[h1]Training & your quick pay off[/h1]
Don't be tempted by previous fightning games that have confusing combos. Them's Fightn' Herd allows you to practice your relatively simple moves in any matter you would like and there are people in game that are willing to help you train as well. Generally, You have to pay attention to your opponents range and what attack is apporpriate for their distance. I picked up the range and moves to use so fast, I was generally surprised with myself.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
While this is still a new game, You can generally point out which characters still need work. Genearally speaking, their characters design still seems to be in progress. However, the characters are pretty well designed, in terms of their "art design attack", which is the animation whenever they attack. The scenery is also very pretty and has matching music to really get the player ready for their opponent.

Overall..
If you're new to fightning games try it out! It's really easy to pick up and learn.

If you already have [u]Skull Girls...[/u] You get a [b] DISCOUNT [/b] for the game. [i]at the time of this review post...[/i]

Like horses, deers, sheep, llamas, lizards, or COWS! Then look no further.

40333159.review:
[h1]I think If you enjoy skull girls type of fighting game then you may enjoy this game.[/h1]

Those of you that have been following the games development will know that the developers really care about this game to continue after their struggles in the development of their games.

Each charecter has a unique fighting style, design and personality to each of them.
The stages are as unique as the charecters.

The game has a lobby system that allows you to select a pixel version of one of the fighters and chat with other players in the lobby as you explore a hub world of a lobby. You can also dress your charecter in their pixel form with a bunch of items. Skull girls players will get 2 hats and a neck piece.

The pixel version of the charecter you pick matters as there is a feature in the game that allows you to go salt mining in the caves of the lobby world and find chests full of salt but in the caves are shadowy predators of herd animals that will chase your pixel charecter and begin a fight. They will keep coming until you have been beaten. The pixel charecter you chose will be the charecter you fight off the predators with.

It is important to note that the game is still in early access meaning that it is not quite complete yet and some charecters still have frames of attacks that need to be finished first. Currently the game has card board cut out like sketches as replacements for missing frames on some charecters and their attacks. Some of these are quite distracting. I have no doubt that they will look as nice as the rest of the animations once complete though.

One personal complaint I have about how the game plays is the dashing, it is short and does not close much of a distance making getting in close for an attack difficult. I have encounterd multiple fights where I have had to dash many times to get close to the other player as they keep a large distance with ranged attacks. This is a problem in many fighting games but with the dash in this game it feels harder to close the gap than others.

Like Skull Girls this game is a good game to start with for those of you who that may be intrested in getting into 2d fighting games.

40332024.review:
Habt ihr auch eine kleine Schwester, eine Tochter oder eine Cousine, die My Little Pony oder Filly Pferde sammelt? Und ihr habt euch schon immer gefragt, was an diesen bescheuerten kleinen Sammelfiguren so toll ist? Also, ich meine, die sch*** Kunsstoffviecher sind schweineteuer und liegen überall nur rum... Aber zum Glück teilt nicht jeder diese Meinung und somit kam der Tag, an dem ein Mitglied des Entwickler-Teams von Mane6, einen super Einfall hatte. Es müsste ungefähr so abgelaufen sein: 
"Hey Leute, was haltet ihr von der Idee, wenn wir Ponys, Kühe und Lamas gegeneinander kämpfen lassen? Ich meine nicht so realistische Dinger, ich rede eher von so Glücksbärchi-Verschnitte, die so süß aussehen, dass man vom bloßen Anblick Zahnschmerzen bekommt. Aber sie bekämpfen sich mit Feuer, Laser und schwarzer Magie und so. Beißen und kratzen, schlagen und treten, spucken und schießen. Halt so richtig BÄM! So richtig in die Fresse und so!  Und mit schicker 2D-Grafik und Spielstil und Animationen, wie in diesen typisch japanischen Prügelgames à la BlazBlue oder Guilty Gear. Na was haltet ihr davon?"
"Mensch, geile Idee! Und dann machen wir noch so eine Lobby, wo sich die Spieler treffen und sich gegenseitig herausfordern können. Und wir fügen noch einen Dungeon ein, wo man auf Itemjagt gehen kann."
"Los Leute, macht euch an die Arbeit!"

Und daraufhin veröffentlichte das Team am 22. Februar 2018 ein Videospiel, welches auch mich davon überzeugte, dass kleine niedliche und rosafarbene Tierchen der absolute Hammer sein können!

Edit: Wer die wahre Entstehungsgeschichte lesen möchte, das Cummunity-Mitglied Sponandi, schrieb sie mir in die Kommentare. Vielen Dank.

40330914.review:
[spoiler] 养老中的isilmë [/spoiler]
游戏外的前言：
大概是15年2月初吧，我建立了fighting_is_magic这个贴吧，自然也申请了大吧，同时也成功当上了。
贴吧成立初期，本身FIM就是小众游戏，根本就没有什么人知道，我自然是做各种外交啊之类的，希望有更多的人能关注这个贴吧。我在各个吧写过帖子， 也给大家找过游戏，整理过出招表，写过快捷键软件，[spoiler] 甚至还教大家搭梯子（ [/spoiler]都是希望贴吧能够火起来，或者至少有更多的人能关注。我几乎每天都去百度上搜相关内容，看看百度的挖掘算法有没有把我贴吧里的东西挖出来。（笑

同时也要感谢小吧的帮助，在贴吧几乎没什么人的时候能够来帮助我找资源、发帖子等等，真的十分感谢。[spoiler] 迄今为止小马宝莉格斗是魔法吧快2400的关注发帖量只有4000出头，我的贴吧关注虽然才300多，发帖量却快有5000了，而且当年还是我吧更火（ [/spoiler]

然而mane6早就收到了Hasbro的律师函，FIM游戏本身几乎是靠着“同人的同人”在支撑着。随着时间的过去，TFH项目的宣布，FIM相关内容变少，telepone也几乎不更新了[spoiler] telepone本身联机也不咋样 [/spoiler]。同时学业变得繁重，热情逐步消退[spoiler] 懒癌了 [/spoiler]，我慢慢地不发帖子，不去贴吧，FIM吧自然就被慢慢地荒废了，QQ群也变成了养老群。这一点我感到十分的对不起。好在FIM有个国人群，有很多的dalao，弄得红红火火。

现在TFH出了，我十分希望能够TFH能够火起来，千万不要有人像我一样做了反面教材（笑


游戏本身：
虽然，没错，这游戏本身的受众就很明确，我也确实想给个好评。
但从游戏本身完成度等等来说，我暂时还是给一个差评比较好。这个差评并不是说游戏本身不好或者怎么样，[spoiler] 要不然我也不会买买买了（ [/spoiler] 只是方便对游戏缺点的反馈。
这个游戏的优点可以参照LAndy大佬的评论，在此我就不赘述了。（大家也可以加群啊： 365617365 [spoiler] 一堆热心大佬的群 [/spoiler]
但有一些缺点我还是要说出来。
首先是键位的改动问题。虽然从FIM开始，mane6就表现出对键盘的轻视，[spoiler] 要不然我也不会为了键盘去整理了出招表了 [/spoiler] 但游戏本身发售于steam，注定了是pc的游戏，大多数人是没有手柄或摇杆的。而每个人的习惯又是不同的。这就导致了预设的键位并不能满足所有人的要求，键位的改动是必然的。然而mane6在键位的改动上虽然支持了同一个角色键位重叠的自动换位，但player1和player2的重叠是不支持键位自动换位的。这就导致键位改动如果碰上player1和player2的冲突，改键操作就变得十分反人类。这是mane6没有考虑到的地方。
其次，游戏本身是不平衡的，TIANHUO[spoiler] RD [/spoiler]惨遭削弱[spoiler] 血量最少并且开局没有能量，取消闪电，取消地面236c等等 [/spoiler]，VELVET[spoiler] RR [/spoiler]招数施放简化同时单hit伤害最高，甚至有大半套连招那么疼。希望之后mane6能改得更加平衡（虽然厨向游戏，但平衡总是好的）[spoiler] 或许是我太菜觉得不平衡呢 [/spoiler]
同时，这游戏还有一些bug，希望大家能多多反馈，也希望mane6能够尽早修复。
最后这游戏完成度确实还不是那么高，虽然核心玩法是有了，但也希望mane6能增加更多元素进去，我也很期待还未解锁的剧情模式。
[spoiler]  这游戏总体来说我应该给个好评的，但就我本身来说之前对FIM键盘键位方面的事操了不少心，键盘键位的问题我确实不怎么希望见到，而且解决这个问题应该也很方便，但mane6居然没有想到，完全是mane6疏忽。希望大家能够原谅我因为自己的任性给的这个差评吧（ [/spoiler]
[spoiler] 问题解决了会改成好评的 [/spoiler]
[spoiler] 话说有大佬准备联系mane6做官中么（ [/spoiler]

40328486.review:
What you're paying for isn't some huge budget fighter such as Dragon Ball FighterZ (which recently released), but what you ARE paying for is a passion project built from what used to be an already amazing My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic fighting game (before Hasbro shut it down for obvious legal reasons).

The game was built from the ground up with help from the creator of MLP:FiM Lauren Faust to make a completely original, yet simple, fighting game based around the 6 character simplistic fighting game that the old MLP game was.

Like I said before, this wasn't just a game, it was a passion project from Kickstarter that took a few years to make, and I can personally say that I like the outcome so far, even without the story (which is coming soon as of this review). The fighting isn't hard to learn but maintains the heart of a fighting game without becoming a jugglefest (due to a juggle cap, which is an incredible feature).

The pixel lobby is a great idea. Like in Dragon Ball FighterZ, there's a lobby of 20 players where you can choose your favorite character, put a hat or neckless on them for fun, and chat in the lobby. You start multiplayer fights there, make friends, or be silly with random people! It's my favorite addition to the game.

From a DMCA take-down to a Steam release, I'm glad to finally be a part of the process of a kickstarted game, watching it grow over the years into what it is, and look forward to seeing where it goes now.

I don't even like fighting games. I do love cute furry characters, though!

40327133.review: I love this fighter! The cast might be small but each character plays so different that the six initial characters bring a lot of variety to the game. It's simple enough to pick up that you don't have to be a master at fighting games and yet each character's moveset has enough depth to really get some good combos going and mechanics to master. The style and music are just beautifully done. While I'm not a huge fan of some of the voices they are also done wonderfully as well. So if you're looking for an easy to pick up fighting game to have some fun with while still suitable for experienced fighting game players then I would highly recommend picking up this game! Hope to see you around in the Pixel Lobby!!

40326555.review:
First of all, this is a [b]Do not buy it yet[/b] and not a [b]Do not buy it ever[/b] review.

This game has lot of potential and good ideas in it, like:
◘ [b]Pixel lobby[/b], where you can move with your selected pixel fighter and talk/play with others in the same lobby.
◘ [b]Character based music[/b], since the background music's instruments are based on the characters in play. (Funny that the cow's instrument is an electric guitar)
◘ [b]Arcade mode[/b], where the AI uses a sharingan to block all of your attacks and counter you anytime when you would hit them.
◘ [b]Story mode[/b], at least in theory since it is not in the early acces yet.
◘ [b]Challenges[/b], where you destroy targets with specified characters, trying to beat your own time record in target destroying. (Maybe it will change to online leaderboard later)

But the potential does not mean the success in my opinion.
It is a fact that it is in early access, meaning that it has plenty of bugs yet. This is why you should not buy it [b]yet[/b].
This game does not that different from other fightning games which are actually working.

The problems are...
◘ [b]Some of the animations and sounds are not finished.[/b] Meaning that, you will see animation frames when your character will be a doodle, and skills which are just pencil drawings. And won't hear any sound at some point either. (It is an early access, yes. But this is the first time when I see a game with doodles in it. Releasing a game like that is just silliness.)
◘ [b]Scripting errors[/b] making your time harder, using your abilities are not guaranteed when you press the key combination for it. Sometimes you need to press the keys slower, sometimes faster. Putting them into a combo is not easy, not working all the time when you just do the same moves thus you lose your combo.
◘ [b]Set up the controls is a pain.[/b] There is a [u]must have[/u] player 2 in the game that you cannot turn off. If you want to use this game alone and so config your keyboard like that, then you need to configure the player 2's controls first and put its keys away, like next to the ENTER key.


It is obviously would be an enjoyable fightning game just like the other titles... But till said other titles are working properly, this game is less than them.
The only difference is that you play with four legged cute/nice creatures instead of two legged demons and other humans.

I bought this game cuz I like MLP, so do like the design of this game. But design is not everything. 
I will change my review as the game develops and the errors might get fixed.

Until then, I suggest not to buy it [b]yet[/b], except if you really wanted to play with four legged cute creatures and like the design / art.

40325888.review:
Kod otrzymałem dzięki wpłaceniu pieniędzy na kampanię w Indiegogo.

Pierwsze wrażenia - gra warta swojej ceny, ale ma klika bolączek i błędów, które przeszkadzają w rozgrywce, zwłaszcza jeśli nie planujesz grać w sieci.

+ Pikselowe lobby. Pokój czatowy z możliwością wezwania kogokolwiek do walki. Najbardziej wciągający tryb ze wszystkich obecnie dostępnych.
+ Kiedy wszystko działa dobrze, system walki sprawia ogromną satysfakcję.
+ Muzyka wpada w ucho, a grafika nie jest zła.

? Tylko 6 postaci. Niby łatwo znaleźć swojego maina i każda z nich ma swój własny styl gry, ale jeszcze co najmniej dwie postacie by się przydały. Tak, wiem, że potwierdzono jedną dodakową postać, ale oceniam to, co mam.

- Kod sieciowy. W ciągu 2 godzin grania po sieci aż trzy razy oberwałem okropnym lagiem, a to bijatyka, więc...
- Sztuczna inteligencja wymaga większego balansu, co było wadą już w czasach Fighting is Magic. Możliwość zmiany poziomu trudności jest niepotrzebnie zakopana w opcjach zamiast w menu trybu arcade.
- Pozostałe tryby są głównie albo niedokończone, albo niedostępne. Pomińmy już tryb historii - arcade cierpi przez AI i brak ekranów końcowych (mimo tego, że są w plikach gry), multiplayer oprócz pikselowych lobby istnieje tylko lokalnie, a trybom treningowym przydałoby się więcej opcji dla nowicjuszy.
- Brakuje parę klatek animacji, ale jest to mało zauważalne.

Ale za niewiele ponad 50 złotych? To całkiem tanio, a mam przeczucie, że będzie jeszcze lepiej. Tylko obawiam się czy po wprowadzeniu wszystkiego do gry nie będzie za późno...

40325679.review:
WELCOME TO THE WORLD OF EARLY ACCESS! CRITICISMS AHOY!

- All of the characters are missing little pieces here and there. The big ones are the intro, taunt, and victory animations.The lipsync is nonexistent. Grabbing attacks are also unfinished: you have characters suddenly being flung across the screen as the other does a slide show representation of what a disappointed hug looks like. I can't wait for these to be properly implemented. They'll add a whole 'nother level of fun and make the game feel more finished.

- Paprika's saddle cloth is clipping through her neck in her idle animation.

- One of the stages, Tianhuo's specifically, doesn't have any variations. Others have hardly any, at least compared to Velvet's stage. Again, I'm assuming that these too are still in the oven and more will be on the way. Can't wait.

- Making the Pixel Lobby's controls more obvious (eg. referencing them in the controller menu and referencing them in the top right corner of the screen along with the server's stats and lobby settings) would definently help us keyboard peasants just so we're not mashing our keys to figure out how to exit a lobby if we impatiently skip the 2 slide tutorial (I actually did this, and was in a world of regret for half-an-hour). The other lobbies are still being worked on.

When these things get fixed I will wholeheartedly recommend this game. For now though, I'd hold onto your wallet. Gives the developers some incentive to fix this stuff, y'know? For what it is worth, despite these missing little things, I've still enjoyed the game.
